articles.title: Oil jumps as EU weighs Russian ban, Saudi refinery output hit - Reuters
articles.description: Oil prices jumped more than $3 on Monday, with Brent above $111 a barrel, as European Union nations consider joining the United States in a Russian oil embargo, while a weekend attack on Saudi oil facilities caused jitters.
articles.content: SINGAPORE, March 21 (Reuters) - Oil prices jumped more than $3 on Monday, with Brent above $111 a barrel, as European Union nations consider joining the United States in a Russian oil embargo, while … [+3022 chars]

articles.author: Kevin Liptak, CNN
articles.title: Biden's European trip will be heavy on displays of Western unity but could be light on actions to stop Putin's Ukraine war - CNN
articles.description: President Joe Biden and his fellow world leaders hope to finalize and unveil a package of new measures to punish Russia, help Ukraine and demonstrate Western unity at a string of emergency summits in Europe this week.

articles.title: The Big Read: Stagflation nightmare - will prices keep rising even as a European war puts damper on economy? - CNA
articles.description: Amid rising inflation and the possibility of a protracted war in Ukraine, experts are warning that the global economy could go into stagflation, where a stagnant economy meets high inflation.
articles.content: There was a time when many economists thought it would be impossible to have a situation where a country faced a high inflation rate while grappling with stagnant economic growth and high unemploymen… [+2939 chars]

articles.title: Europe’s 1st mission to Mars ‘could be delayed until 2028’ because of Ukraine invasion, scientist claim... - The Irish Sun
articles.content:
A MAJOR Mars mission to find out whether life ever existed on the planet could be delayed by up to six years at best, as Europe scrambles to replace Russian parts.

articles.title: Russian, Ukrainian ballet performers raise funds in Dance For Ukraine charity event - CNA
